intro: Acer lobulatum, commonly known as the red maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its opposite, palmately lobed leaves that turn vibrant shades of red in autumn. The tree produces small, red to green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds called samaras. It typically grows to a height of 15–30 meters and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping and urban environments.
